comment: Perfect gateway bourbon for friends who think drinking neat isn't their thing.

Recommendation: Easy to drink, great for a beginner.  Just...okay.

Smell: So sweet it’s almost flat, but I loved the smell

Taste: smooth finish, a lot of caramel. Almost a bit dry but light tasting. 

Price: $28 I think it’s overpriced by a few dollars
nice oak ...Sweet and salty ... earthy and floral
Sweet, oaky, and light..86.6 proof, I am a fan of the under 100. We shall see how my taste change over time.

Nose: candied pecans, butter, apple juice, cinnamon, nutmeg, oak, black pepper, some rye, a little heat

Taste: burnt brown sugar, honey, heat, oak, finish starts with black peppery, then leads to a sour rye/maple note.

**Duplicate entry from the non-vintage listing.**  Bottle pour, neat, into Glencairn at home. Barreled on 1-5-11, barrel 3, bottled on 11-13-18. Nose is smooth caramel and butterscotch, some overripe apples. Beautiful. Taste brings some oak and spice to the mix, but the caramel stays underneath as a great base. Really nice, with a very pleasant lingering sweetness accented with just a hint of heat. Quite good. 6/8/19

Comapred an old 2010 bottle to the 2011.

Nose: Mellow. Corn, some spice, toffee

Taste: Sweetness, a little sour touch, rye spices come and go. Finish leaves lasting oak, some apple, and a little heat - yum!

While my 2010 bottle might be a bit oxidized, i think the 2011 is ultimately sweeter, spicier, and better. The 2010 was smooth from when I first pened it, but the 2011 has some wonderful spice notes.

Nose - oak

Taste - more, heavier oak.. dusty/earthy, low heat, 

Finish - lingers but light 

Good value for money...  but nothing special
This is a really nice daily drinker. Very smooth and flavorful.
Surprisingly smooth. Great aftertaste. One of my favorite sipping bourbons under $40.
Loving this one. Barreled 8/25/11, barrel #1302, bottled 10/1/19. Def going to grab another while still on sale for under $30!

This bottle is barreled 2/3/11 bottled 8/19/19 barrel # 1108.........Better than the 2008 vintage I had before. Poured neat nose has plenty of caramel and butterscotch with oak and resin and a touch of stewed fruit. Palate is buttery smooth with  rich caramel, heavy oak, anise and peppery spice. Excellent flavor delivery and has some depth. Finish is standard dry barrel oak but the sweet buttery notes linger setting this apart. Not super complex but great value here at high 20$-low30$ for a single barrel age statement bourbon. Im gonna grab another of this years edition........90/100.....very impressed, best EW ive had to date despite lower proof. Will become a mainstay for me

Nose - oily, floral. 
Palate - basic. Oily. Floral.

For a value single barrel, Evan Williams single barrel (2011) is a very pleasant sipper! My experience with single barrels (which I admit is fairly limited) can be hit or miss. This year must have been a decent one.  This sipper has a light mouthfeel with distinct oakiness and a sweet/candied peppery finish. If you haven’t tried it before, I recommend grabbing a bottle. Again for a single barrel that is sub $30 it is a good value!
Honey honey honey. Caramel. Minimal burn. Finish is acidic

Good bourbon color
Alcohol aroma not for me
Nice Oak flavor 
Long tingly finish
Classic bourbon nose with a little spice. Lighter, floral notes to taste that is well balanced. Very good price for a SB expression. Daily sipper.

Barreled: 8/4/11
Barrel No. 1393
Bottled: 10/14/19

Nose is smokey.
Taste is caramel and smoke.
Lots of sweet notes, no burn. Remarkable bourbon for $22.00

Sweet and strong oak at first, just right balance of spice, gentle burn that heats up slightly with a slight alcohol spiced long finish.   Very straightforward bourbon that is very very good.  Second pour coming up!
Clove hot tamales cinnamon toast toast
Has a sweet taste and fragrance to it.

COLOR/ Light Honey.
AROMA/ Sweetness, Fruits, Wood, Slight Caramel, Delightful Alcohol, Some Smokiness.
FIRST SIP/ Smooth, Light, Sweet, Slight Wood, Ever So Slight bitterness.
TASTE/ Sweet Wood, Slight Carmel & Vanilla, Slight Apple. 
FINISH/ Slight Oil, Lingers with Smoothness, Sweet, Bold, Richness & Robustness
MT GLASS/ Sweetness, Woodiness, Carmel, Delightful
86.6 proof

This is Super Smooth & Super Delicious. It is Greatly Delicious I can't think of much more to say...
Bottle D33ts
- Barreled on 8.25.2011
- Barrel # 1230
- Bottled on 9.16.2019
- Barrel Days 2944

Be Kind, Be Generous, Be Real, Be Responsible!!!
CH33RS
Smooth.  Nice warm finish, but fairly oaky.
Great for the price. A lot of sweet notes, rich mouthfeel, smooth finish. Not a lot of alcohol taste.
Just an all around great bourbon! This review was from barrel no. 806 aged just under 8 years. One of the best bangs for your buck out there!
Sweet up front. Caramel notes. Never thought I’d like an Evan Williams.
A little bitter and warm, clears the nose :) straight up. A lot better on the rocks.
